heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: The last storm was on 16 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (201°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.8°C) and outside temperature (up 1.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1140 m) and light levels (up 3634 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 37.9m lower than yesterday, 519.9m lower than the past week, 1140.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 689m to a maximum of 1098m, averaging 831.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1351.2m and 1971.4m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather patterns to stay the same.
